website_summaries.verdict: A good price for more than one drain snake.
pros: Includes three drain snakes in 19.6-inch or 23.6-inch sizes
Easily grabs hair, food, and other obstructions
Soft enough to bend around pipes
cons: Barbs can get stuck if you pull up too quickly or you're using with a smaller opening, which then can make them break

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!! Broke First use
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT! IT WILL BREAK IN YOUR PIPES MAKING YOU HAVE TO DISASSEMBLE YOUR PLUMBING. I went to use this item and it broke off in my drain thee first time I used it. I wasn't exerting any real pressure it broke with only a slight tug. Now i need a plumber to come and disassemble my kitchen drain, so this cheap little device will likely cost me a couple of hundred dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Nick F

customer_reviews.title: Drain cleaning will never be the same again
customer_reviews.text: At our house there are 3 women whom all use the same shower/tub; one has very long, straight hair, one with very thick and curly hair, and the last with a mixture of both. After changing the drain multiple times I understand why my dad was always so frustrated with me not helping out with drain cleaning. Thanks to this tool, the job takes probably 3-5 minutes. It's a shame they aren't reusable but gosh are they amazing. They're already pre-curved so they fit down the pipe like a dream and latch onto anything in their path. I adore these.
customer_reviews.author: Miss CCTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: It works!!!
customer_reviews.text: Omg! Couldn’t wait to post this review! Just received these today and was anxious to try it after months of a clogged bathroom sink. I tried liquid drain cleaner, plungers, hot water etc. nothing worked. I was skeptical because I had just about given up and was going to call a plumber but I thought why not? Can’t hurt! Well, after no more than 5-10 minutes (probably not that long) I was pulling up clumps of hair. I did about 3-4 passes down the drain and voila, it worked!! Water ran straight down the drain! No pooling in the sink! Try these before you call that plumber. It worked !
customer_reviews.author: HELLO KITTY

customer_reviews.title: Too flexible to work well
customer_reviews.text: Worthless. Have used the ones from the hardware store multiple tones and thought I would give these a shot. The are too flexible and blunt point (cut with clippers to no avail) to make it through hair clog that others go through every six months without issue. They are so curved up instead of straight they do not the through the very first turn of the catch even. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: J. Moran

customer_reviews.title: Would not work for my tub
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure these work for some applications, but I could not get it to work in my tub. It just would not make the downward bend. Went back to my coathanger with a little hook on the end and that pulled the hair out. -- Subsequently tried it for cleaning my bathroom sink and it seemed to work OK for that. The only minor caveat is that since the snakes are curled for packaging they tend to want to remain curled and retain some springiness. So, when removing it from the drain, you have to be careful that you control the tip with one hand and don't let it flick yuck all over the room.
customer_reviews.author: RN

customer_reviews.title: Snapped in half on first use
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional handyman - and always carry a Zipit for the simple drain stopper clogs. I decided to try these because of the reviews and lower cost per unit. today I inserted the tool in a drain from which the stopper was removed and gently removed it - the teeth not only broke off, they got caught in the drain's overflow slot. A fluke? then I tried running it in again and this time the whole tool snapped in half upon withdrawal - and the clog didn't even involve any hair... just soap buildup! If it had snapped farther down, I'd have had to fish the end out of the drain. Zero stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jungle Pete

customer_reviews.title: MAYBE good for a sink
customer_reviews.text: I would not use this for any other drain other than a sink drain. I did not try it on my sink, so I’m sure if that even works either. However, I did try it out my clogged shower drain multiple times and it did nothing. The plastic wouldn’t conform to the curvature of my pipes and I had a hard time reaching the clog even though I got the longest pack. I had to give up and just buy the liquid chemical declogger instead which obviously did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Freisy

customer_reviews.title: Never Again!
customer_reviews.text: This is priced fair for the intended job and available for 1 day delivery. However, that is where the pros ended for me. It is a rigid plastic which doesn't bend as easily because of the 'thorns' on it, and that is EXACTLY how they feel, too. Next, these thorns stuck to everything from the package they came in to the drain pipe going down. So much so that they inhibited the ability to snake the device down the pipe far enough to grab anything. Then, it was a total struggle to bring it back up, let alone without injury, and it produced nothing! Total fail for me. Avoid, avoid, avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, flimsy junk. Broke in first minute of use
customer_reviews.text: In a household with two women with long hair, I’m never not cleaning out swamp monsters from the bath drain. In 20 years, this is the first time I’ve ever seen one break. So now I’ve got 10” of plastic also clogging my drain. Awesome. This product is cheaply made, not designed to actually be used in the fashion it’s intended. Get a different brand or go to a different store. These are cheap junk.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic breaks on first use
customer_reviews.text: The plastic “spikes” that are supposed to help pull the hair and other scum out of the drains broke off on my first use, leaving more debris (the little orange bits of plastic) in my drain. I tried them on two sinks and the bathtub. I was disappointed that it didn’t actually pull out more crud, including the hair I could SEE in the drain but that it didn’t actually grab.
customer_reviews.author: Laura McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Please DON'T buy these! We live in a world with plastic islands! Get a metal snake.
customer_reviews.text: First, I'm mad at myself for buying them, for not thinking of the environmental impact and harm to animals once disposed of. Can you imagine what that would do with those nasty barbs? I must have been in a fog that day! That's on me. I finally tried one and it broke in the bathtub drain anyway. Had to get needle-nose pliers and work very carefully to retrieve it. It disturbed a hair or two but came up pretty much empty and I teased the rest out with my fingers. Stick to an old fashioned reusable snake. Sometimes we get caught up in the hype I guess. I hope Amazon drops them!!!
customer_reviews.author: KF

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: Horrible, I barely put it in the drain and it broke off and now I have a big long orange piece down my drain that I can’t get out
customer_reviews.author: yvette procter

customer_reviews.title: So close to worthless....
customer_reviews.text: One of the three devices was broken upon delivery. So, I got two for the price of three. The plastic is very hard, the spikes along the edges bite into your hands, and the plastic tool fights you as you try to push it into the drain. While it might appear that the tools can be strung together to create a longer tool than the 19.6", that cannot be done, and the effective reach of the tool is just over 12". For most kitchen sink drains, it is nearly impossible to push the tool through the drain cover and into the drain, and the tool will not reach the first elbow in the drain. Pretty orange color, though.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas J

customer_reviews.title: Save your Money
customer_reviews.text: These things are worthless. When you stick it down the drain they are so stiff so you can't do much with it, as in twisting it to grab the hair, in addition to the burrs on the end that " should grab hair from the drain " are too short to do the deed. I full time in an RV and my hair is always clogging the drain in my shower and I thought these would be the perfect solution other then my fingers, yuck, but nope, great idea though, maybe make the burrs a little longer and the stem a little more pliable, I may give them another try.
customer_reviews.author: jamie

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT!! Wear gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I have been dealing with a clogged bathtub for the better part of the last year, I can't remove the stopper to clean it out so I've been so frustrated and getting disgusting soap scum all over the side of the tub. I used this today and got SO MUCH STUFF OUT! (I'll admit, my hair was the culprit, 100%) Now the drain is completely cleared and I am able to keep the tub clean and scum free. The snakes are spiked so I had to use a wash cloth to hold it and push it into the drain so it didn't hurt my fingers but I didn't mind at all. HIGHLY recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharee

customer_reviews.title: Hard brittle plasic broke, leaving plastic snake stuck in pipe.
customer_reviews.text: Within seconds, after applying a reasonable amount force to insert the snake, it broke. This resulted in the end being stuck which could make the situation worse - whereby the jagged teeth may be more apt to attach to hair or other pipe-clogging materials. Fortunately, I was able to remove the broken end. I CAN'T RECOMMEND this product. If the manufacturer used the same quality plastic found on a common zip-tie, this may not occur but the material used is brittle and easily broken.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Worked well to get past my lift & turn drain stopper!
customer_reviews.text: Don't ruin your pipes by pouring chemicals into your drains - use one of these instead! This tool works very well to remove long hair from a tub drain. My tub has a lift & turn stopper and wasn't draining properly when we showered. It would fill up with about 2 inches of water because of all the hair down in the drain. This tool was thin enough and easily slipped down along the side of the tub stopper piece and the barbs grabbed the hair very well. I had to repeat the process a few times to get it all out, but it drains perfectly now. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: DeDe C.

customer_reviews.title: Got stuck in drain, didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pack of three a while ago just try to use it tonight. My bathroom drain was starting to slow and so I thought I’d give it a try. Honestly I didn’t think I was going to be able to get it out. It kept catching on something, I have no idea what. It brought very little stuff up with it. I am too nervous to try again, maybe it’s the kind of drain I have but it looks like it just won’t work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Newf lover

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't fit completely down my bathroom sink drain or my bathtub drain, but that's mostly due to the design of the drains. I'm agreeing with others who have said it works better than Liquid Plumber or Drano. I've put both down the sink drain, doesn't work. I put this down, was amazed but happy to see the debris it brought up, mostly hair (mine, I have long hair). I put it down three times, different angles. I do use a "tub schroom" in the bathtub, but it still drains slowly. Was hoping this would bring up lots of debris, but not as much as I'd hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy these. Buy the Zip-it Brand
customer_reviews.text: When I used it, it broke off in the drain. I tried a second & that one broke off in the drain. When I arrived home I compared your product to the Zip-it brand at my house. The plastic used by Zip-it is flexible, yours is so rigid that it just cracks off. Now it's a hair CATCHER and a giant plumber bill. Please send me my money back
customer_reviews.author: The Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: lower price for a reason
customer_reviews.text: two broke on one drain. the plastic is too brittle . I bought one at the store that lasted three years. this plastic on these orange ones is way too weak . The third and last hair removal tool did the job but was obviously damaged from the one time it entered the drain so it was in the trash too.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: somewhat effective plastic junk
customer_reviews.text: You are really rolling the dice with these brittle, barbed plastic ribbons: maybe they will bring up the clog in your pipe, maybe they will snap off inside the pipe and leave you worse off than when you started. For our clogged bathroom sink, each ribbon lasted two pulls before starting to tear near the handle. Didn't do much to unclog our drain either. I feel bad for wasting money and worse for contributing to more plastic landfill crap.
customer_reviews.author: nustita

customer_reviews.title: Useless!
customer_reviews.text: Sounded like a great idea but this cheap flexible piece of plastic with little barbs is too wide to fit fit down any drain in my house except one and when I put it down that one I almost could not get it out. When I did finally did get it out most of the little barbs were mashed down. I threw them away. At least they were not expensive! After reading other reviews, I think it is also important to say it sometimes breaks off in the pipe requiring a plumber to get it out. Mine didn't break but it sure was hard to get it out.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Evans

customer_reviews.title: Thrash on a stick
customer_reviews.text: Literally trash on a stick. It comes curled up and is made of such stiff, unyielding plastic that it is impossible to maneuver down the drain. You must actively push it down into the drain and it is very difficult to pull back up. In the pulling, all the little teeth rip off the central stick, leaving them in the drain with the original, offending hair, etc. It is meant to remove detritus from your drain but, instead it just deposits more junk in there. Tossed the others immediately- junk!
customer_reviews.author: Royceag

customer_reviews.title: Painful and not practical
customer_reviews.text: These cut and scratched up my hands and was not worth the pain for the amount of effort required to get it to work. The teeth kept getting caught inside the drain and pulling it out was a nightmare. It removed the surface clog and I had to use Draino for the rest which defeated the purpose of using this tool to begin with. I'm going to stick with the winding plastic snaking rod I purchased from Amazon previously - so much easier and pain free
customer_reviews.author: Blessed Momma

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do what it claims.  Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: These are garbage. They are not flexible enough to bend and move through the trap. They have the length (as I bought the longer version), but it doesn't matter. In the end I had to dismantle the drain to remove the hair clog (because I refuse to pour heavy chemicals down the drain) had the thing been flexible enough it would have caught the clog just past the trap. Haven't even decided if worth the effort to try and return or just throw away. Don't waste your time with these.
customer_reviews.author: Geebs

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easy buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have mentioned these things break super easy. I’ve bought the ones from big box stores before and they never ever broke. These broke within 10 seconds and by the looks of it at the same part near the handle which means they have a manufacturing defect. The broken piece, pretty much all of it save the handle, will end up in your drain and be impossible to remove. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Broke in my drain
customer_reviews.text: I was using this to, as you might expect, get some hair out of a drain. Our drain has an X'shape where the tub plug screws into and this is where most of the hair was caught. I put the snake around/through this piece to get into the drain and when I pulled back up the snake broke in half. I then had to spend 20 minutes trying to get the broken piece back out of the drain with needle-nose pliers. Needless to say, this piece is too flimsy to pull out any massive clogs (ours was actually very small) and I immediately threw the other two snakes in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: MelissaMH

customer_reviews.title: First time user; won't order again...
customer_reviews.text: These orange "snake" type devices come in two lengths and I ordered the shorter of the two, thinking to use them ONLY on the bathroom sink's drain. They are flimsy making it a bit difficult to feed into the drain and attempt to swirl it around with intent to pull out more debris. The water flow from the basin did increase but only marginally. I'll search for other products next time I'm close to Loew's or Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: Pam and Jerry

customer_reviews.title: It's hard to get excited about this
customer_reviews.text: I both love and hate these things. my shower drain backs up about twice a year, thanks to hard water build up, hair, and, apparently, my choice of body wash (I've since switched). Using toxic drain cleaners is a no-no in this area because we aren't hooked up to a city sewage system and all my shower water ends up back in the ground and slowly making its way into our well water. So to keep our well from turning toxic, I have to use these things. It's gross. But it's effective. In fact, it's even more effective than that time I resorted to Draino. Just know that you will be screaming "Eeewwwww" the whole time you're using this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jacki Cristobal

customer_reviews.title: Worked well once, broke the second time
customer_reviews.text: I have successfully used this product to clean hair out of by bathroom sink and tub drains. However, the second time I used the product it snapped, leaving half the snake in my tub drain. This $6 product is now a several hundred dollar problem as we have to hire a plumber to completely take apart the pipes and remove it. Do not use this brand, it is not worth whatever money you might be saving.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Its not a great product, it doesnt work like you see on TV. I dont know how they made it work because when i tried using the exact method, it either got stuck or bent, Dont bother wasting your money, just get a plumbing snake at your local home depot or lowes for almost the same price.
customer_reviews.author: William P

customer_reviews.title: Broke First Try
customer_reviews.text: I was battling a drain for quite some time, and just couldn't seem to get it to go down. I saw this, and figured I could get it done, and figured this was inexpensive and to the point. I used it as soon as I got it out of the package, and it snapped. I figured it was just "one" problem, then I tried a second one, and it broke too. I figured this was just an isolated incident, no way the third one is going to break, and yep, it snapped too. 3 of them snapped! Fun huh? I eventually got a plumber.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Alberto Orduna SR.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a poor quality item. I had to use all three (3) in the package to attempt to clear merely one (1) clog. After multiple passes from all three (3) snakes I was able to remove some of the hair and grease but not all of it, prior to the ribs falling off into the drain during usage, thereby adding to the clog, essentially.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Barnes

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE!!!! WILL BREAK IN DRAIN FURTHER COMPOUNDING CLOG!!!
customer_reviews.text: So after reading so many glowing reviews I was desperate to try this for my tub! However not only did it not work as well as expected .... as I was trying to pull it out it broke! I now have an unattainable long piece of plastic in my tub drain with absolutely no hope of retrieving it! :( Don't buy this cheap plastic product! I know you may be as tempted as I was to try it but unless you would like to chance it and have it break off in your drain which will further compound future clogs DO NOT USE THIS... complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: M. Courtois

customer_reviews.title: Good type of tool. Too wide, teeth too short, product prone to breaking.
customer_reviews.text: I used the tools for my kitchen, bathroom, and bathtub drains. I got hair out of my bathroom sink. The problem with this tool is that it is too wide to fit in my drains and the teeth don't protrude enough to get hair clogs out. I kept wondering if the tool was going to break because the plastic material is not extremely bendable. My zipper tool began to break which would have caused a problem getting stuck down in the sink. Also, I would recommend the brusher tools. My bathroom sink drain needed cleaning all over. Good type of tool. Too wide, teeth too short, product prone to breaking.
customer_reviews.author: djma6115

customer_reviews.title: BROKE OFF IN DRAIN!
customer_reviews.text: I have long hair and have purchased many of these in the past from other manufacturers. I wished I had stuck with them because this one broke immediately before I even got any hair out of the drain!!! It's cheap hard plastic that bends and snaps very easily, rather than being flexible like others I have purchased. I put it almost halfway in and heard it snap so I pulled it back out and and now there's about 7 inches of plastic stuck in my drain!! NOT happy!
customer_reviews.author: A. Mayorga

customer_reviews.title: Useless !!!
customer_reviews.text: Useless product! Cannot use these! They are hard plastic that broke when I extended them to put in the drain. I have bought a different brand at Walmart that was made of a more flexible material for cheaper. I gave it a one star to ensure this review will be posted.
customer_reviews.author: MoJo61

customer_reviews.title: It broke on first try
customer_reviews.text: I have seen our plumber use these and I thought I would save a few dollars and do it myself. The plumber had one that was not curled (straight as an arrow) and was very simple to use. These come curled (like the picture) and I found it difficult to use. I was trying to bend the the cleaning tool to put in the drain and it broke. I was lucky that it didn't break while down the drain. I did grab another one and it worked as described. I don't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Rickert

customer_reviews.title: BROKE OFF IN DRAIN
customer_reviews.text: It technically did remove the hair from the drain, but it also caused me to spend nearly two hours wrestling it out of the drain because it broke off inside the pipe! A creative combination of a shop vac, extra long needle nose pliers, regular needle nose pliers, and a bent wire hanger finally saved me from a plumbing nightmare that would likely have cost hundreds to fix. All I can say is, if you buy this, don't stick it very far down the drain and make sure you actually have all of the above tools on hand. Actually, all I can say is don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE; it will cost you more than you think.
customer_reviews.text: This broke in my drain. I use drain hoses ALL the time, this has never happened. I grabbed a SECOND one to help grab the one that broke and THAT ONE also broke. I had to call a plumber to come to my house to pull these out of the damn drain as hair was catching on it and making the clog even worse. do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Not quite long enough
customer_reviews.text: I saw these on BuzzFeed and read that they were highly recommended, which made me assume they would definitely work better than the long, spring-like drain clearer I had purchased years ago at Dollar Tree. I decided to give them a try. To my disappointment, they actually did not work as well as what I already had. They’re not very long, so they weren’t as effective. I decided to donate them to my local thrift store in hopes that they might be of better use to someone else.
customer_reviews.author: BreannaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: More trouble than its worth
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of long, curly hair and use these cheap drain snakes about once every two or three months in my shower, they're usually quick and easy and cheap enough to toss them after each use. I've NEVER had one completely break before! The handle of this one snapped off, leaving me with a half a stick stuck in my drain and a whole lot of trouble getting it output! Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for: cheap price, cheap results
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to remove hair in my bathtub drain. Unless your pipe is elongated (not with a curve close to the drain’s opening) it will NOT work! I could only get it to go in 1/2 inch at best. And, your hands get poked pretty band by the barbs. Use a regular snake that’s more bendable than this hard plastic; save your hands from barbs (ouch!!!).
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia Beaverhausen

customer_reviews.title: Risky bussiness
customer_reviews.text: I worked fine and it did take out the long hair and stuff. But the Second time I used plastic broke in the pipe and I had to buy a special bathtub drainage removal tool to take it out. Plastic is too brittle and it breaks very easily, all 3 pieces broke. Do not use it, it will give you more headaches.
customer_reviews.author: Tamer Maximus

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality materials
customer_reviews.text: I've used this style of snake tool in the past but these are just awful. The plastic is so flimsy the entire thing just accordioned in the pipe and wasn't able to grab anything. Tried all three that came in the pack to make sure the first one wasn't just a fluke but all did the exact same thing. Ended up heading out to Home Depot and picking up a more traditional wire snake to clear out the sink and called it a day. At least they were cheap
customer_reviews.author: Troy Kukulka

customer_reviews.title: Buy these!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Omg, these are little miracles! Buy them! I was going to try the baking soda and vinegar thing until I remembered I wasn’t in Chem class and there was enough air built up in the bathroom pipes to cause a combustion big enough to push the clog through. Duh. Then I thought about different (green of course) chemicals to try when I came across these little wonders. I unclogged my bathroom sink in literally 5 min. Maybe less. I threw the first one out because it was really gross. I washed off the second and didn’t even need the third. Thank you Amazon, for stocking a genius product and a chemical free solution!!
customer_reviews.author: Julie C.

customer_reviews.title: People are stupid
customer_reviews.text: It has teeth and it's designed to catch things when you pull up, its going to get "Stuck" on something that's what it's designed to do. My first one broke off but i pulled far too hard when it got stuck on something, I put the second one in and instead of just tugging...I twisted it like a normal patient person should, everything came up, my god so much hair came up. Just don't pull on them like they're never going to break and you should be fine. Edit a month or so later: They emailed me and we chitchatted for a bit. SO I have to update this to 5 stars because that level of customer service is awesome
customer_reviews.author: Me and Just ME

customer_reviews.title: Pulled that Wookiee outta my bathtub drain
customer_reviews.text: I read both the good and bad reviews on these, and decided to try them. I have long thick hair and chemicals have never worked well in the past, and it’s embarrassing to ask a plumber or boyfriend to do the dirty deed, so I pulled the equivalent of a small Pomeranian out of the bathtub drain, and his younger brother out of my sink- using the same one. Didn’t break, did have to fight the tub drain but that’s because it was so badly clogged. I didn’t take pics, but can attest to the pictures previously posted as being spot on to what I yanked out with this tool. Both drains running smooth now.
customer_reviews.author: Pookie

customer_reviews.title: Junk! Broke off in my drain in the first few minutes.
customer_reviews.text: I spent more time going after the broken piece, I think there is actually more still in there, than I did catching hair. I would go with something more durable for bathtub drains, if that's what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Carney

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: I normally buy this type of drain clog remover from my local store, but they were sold out. I bought them from amazon this time thinking it would be the same as the ones I normally buy, but it broke the second I tried to pull it out of the drain. I've never had one from the store break. This one didn't even last one pull and now a good portion of it lives in my drain as I can't get it out without breaking the drain. From now on I'll stock up on the normal store version when they have it on the shelves.
customer_reviews.author: this.is.my.pen.name

customer_reviews.title: Well this thing is just straight up amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Economically priced, speedy delivery, ridiculously simple to use, and very very effective. Both my daughter and my wife are amply tressed, and it has been far too long a time since our last thorough routing out of the shower and sink piping. Lo and behold, this little tool made short work of the effort, and the results were....well I won't describe the deeply caked mass this little tool unearthed out of concern that you might be eating while you shop online. All I will say is that this Snake Hair Drain was money well spent, and I highly recommend it for your drain clog removal needs.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Jones

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: This item did not work for me. I read other reviews and went off of those. People said it would work even with the sink plunger intact but I could barely feed it down and once it was down the drain it got caught on something and it took a cloth wrapped around the piece and lots of muscle to pull it back up. I couldn't even get it to feed down the bath tub drain.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Purchased my home about a year ago and had to use a drain clog liquid product about 6 months ago and it worked well and recently noticed that the drain was slowing and mild puddling at times. Purchased these, the longer length, and one was perfect and honestly only used maybe 6-8” of the end in the drains before I met resistance. The stuff that came out was insane and gross, but in a satisfying way. So easy to use and quick fix. It’s been 2 weeks and drain is emptying smoothly. Would use again is needed. I disposed of the one I used due to the grossness factor, although, you could clean it if wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Used it to clear a bathroom sink drain that's been clogged for a while and draining slow. It was driving me crazy. Saw this product on one of those ubiquitous Amazon listicles and stashed it in my wish list in case I ever needed it. I could not get the stopper out of the drain -- it's a cheapie piece installed by the landlord -- so I worked it around it. Took a little longer but it worked like a charm. I was just careful with it after having read one of the questions about using it with the stopper in place. These things are great!
customer_reviews.author: Lee Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Do It Yourself!
customer_reviews.text: Unless you are bald, you can encounter problems with hair in drains that eventually clog the trap. And if you have medium or long hair you can be assured that you will. I have a brush-type drain cleaner that works well but it is hard to pull the hair and gunk out of the brush so I decided to try this one. It reaches far enough into the sink and shower drain to capture the hair and gunk. Simply insert the drain snake into the drain and turn it in a circular motion to capture the hair and dunk and then pull straight out and deposit it on a paper towel. It is really a life-saver!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Meier Wright

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy & cheap piece of plastic
customer_reviews.text: I have to say this thing sucks.... it came all bent up and it is so flimsy and it didn’t actually do anything so I still have to find something to help me with my little problem... 🤦🏼‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Regine Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy breaks leaving 1/2 of it in your drain!!
customer_reviews.text: These are HORRIBLE and it broke in my drain!!! I have used similar one's from my local hardware store and it lasted for years. I just used this and it literally broke leaving 1/2 of it in my tub drain!! Now I need to call a plumber and it's going to be quite costly as it's not like a sink where you can easily get to the catch trap.. pretty upset
customer_reviews.author: Claire ◇

customer_reviews.title: Beware! Breaks off in your drain.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT FALL FOR IT! Followed video directions meticulously, broke off in our drain within 5 seconds. Now having to call a plumber. Which is exactly what we wanted to avoid during our first week in our home. I reached out to the seller, no response. I always base my purchases off reviews, and I honestly cannot believe this thing has this many complimentary reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Newsom

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This got the job all the way done! I had a clog in my tub and draino did not work, but I came across this and my gosh the amount of hair that was down that pipe! Now the water flushes it out easily! As far as cleaning, 3 comes in the pack I will just toss. I'm sure you wouldn't have to use this thing everyday. I would say maybe once a month
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: plastic broke in the drain
customer_reviews.text: This looked like a great product. First time I used it, it broke inside the drain. Luckily, I was able to fish it out, and did not have to call a plumber. I would not recommend buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: K. White

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done unless it breaks off 6 inches deep inside a drain...
customer_reviews.text: The first one worked great. We have a lot of pet hair in the household, so we didn't buy these for reuse. We used that first one, worked great, and were able to toss it because the price was low enough to not feel guilty about that. The second one (used weeks later, same drain) broke off. Yep, we have about 6 inches of that 2nd one left down the bathtub drain. There's no way to retrieve it and we can hope it will flush out to the septic tank, but no guaranties of that either. So, it might cause a problem later, or it might not.
customer_reviews.author: DabOfDarkness

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: Needed to clean out some drains, and these worked well. When you re pulling the snake out of the drain, they can get hung up - don't panic and yank them out, because they will probably break, and then you've got a real problem - rotate your wrist back and forth and 'wiggle' the snake while pulling it out.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Bananas

customer_reviews.title: Junk. (but nice seller!)
customer_reviews.text: I've used similar items with great success to clear my drains in the past. These popped up and had great reviews, so I took ordered. They are really bad. Instead of grabbing hairs, the little plastic "spokes" or points just break off! Really disappointed that such a simple product was such a failure. ** UPDATE ** 5/15/20 - Seller was gracious enough to reach out and offer a refund because I was dissatisfied with product. Very nice!
customer_reviews.author: ErLu

customer_reviews.title: Too short
customer_reviews.text: Please be aware that the “working” section of this tool is about 16”. The International Residential Code says a p-trap can be a max of 24” from the drain. I just discovered this when this tool did not work for the tub so I googled. I got a small amount of pulled hair but I don’t think the tool is reaching the main, revolting, disgusting glob. Get a longer tool. Save yourself.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: complete trash. very brittle, broke off in the drain.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first thing I've gotten off amazon that ended up being complete garbage. The plastic on these are so brittle. The little teeth got snagged and the whole thing snapped in half! Now I've got this plastic thing clogging up my drain too! TRASH!
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Galinak

customer_reviews.title: This ugly little orange monstrosity works!
customer_reviews.text: I had a tub with a blocked drain. Two full treatments of Drano didn’t put a dent in it. It laughed at a drain probe. Then it laughed at The Drain Millipede. Finally I went after it with this orange monstrosity. Surprise! The drain was cleared in five minutes. Mind you, it was a brutal five minutes and what came out of the drain was really nasty. But where everything else fails, this orange strip of thorny plastic worked, and worked quickly. It’s cheap, it’s brutal, it’s fast and it works. I’d give it six stars if I could. Got a blocked drain? Try this first.
customer_reviews.author: Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Breaks within minutes
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. I used it once and within a couple of minutes it not only snapped in half making it super short and unusable but also teeth fall out. You will probably use it once and get the job done half as. I use to have good quality one that I used over and over for years. This is not that type of plastic or product. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Noname

customer_reviews.title: Not quite a snake but helps with drain issues.
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect these to be as good as taking your drain apart and cleaning all the gunk out. However, they are cheap... easy to use... and can help control the build-up of hair in drains. I wouldn't expect to get a ton of use from each one but they're so cheap it's not even a concern. Definitely use caution when pulling them out because you can fling crud into your face or all over the sink area. The item title calls it a snake. I'm iffy on that because these are nothing like the old metal cable snakes you shove down drains. Buy again? I would.
customer_reviews.author: TruthBeTold

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your time or money
customer_reviews.text: Figured these were worth a try on our clogged bathroom sink. Total mistake, the plastic teeth that are supposed to grab whatever is clogging your pipes grabbed everything but. A bunch of the plastic teeth broke off and have further clogged my drain. Literally made my problem exponentially worse.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Kerrigan

customer_reviews.title: Sticks in the drain
customer_reviews.text: If it wasn't curved like a circle it would work much better. The hard plastic makes the curve hard to manipulate into and out of a drain. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: hms23836

customer_reviews.title: I like my wire hanger better
customer_reviews.text: I was not really impressed with this, although if I had not already been using a wire hanger with a small hook on it, I probably would of loved this, but it did not work as well as my hanger, my hanger gets stuck sometime coming out on the drain opening , so I did like that about this not getting stuck ... but it did not bring up as much hair as the hanger ......but its ok, I will still use it ..... didnt work to well on the bathroom sink thou...... but its ok
customer_reviews.author: Hillbilly Deb

customer_reviews.title: Broke easily; much better versions of similar product exist
customer_reviews.text: Have used a similar product many times. The other one I've used was packaged flat. These were curled up in a bag which made them form to that shape. So after pulling them back up from the drain it would fling back to that shape. Gross. Also the teeth on these easily broke off during use. I never experienced that with the other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ejh

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t get the job done
customer_reviews.text: Don’t throw your money away buying this. Very poorly made. Cheap plastic that broke (not in my drain, thankfully) after 2 times trying to get it more than halfway down my drain. It’s package in a circular shape, when it should probably be shipped flat. Or maybe if it’s left out long enough it’ll straighten out? Who has the time for that. Annoyed but not surprised. Actually purchased a hand snake since I ordered this but wanted to give it the benefit of the doubt. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: VIN

customer_reviews.title: Brittle and broke — DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Sorry Vastar the drain snake snapped off and broke two times — first when using it and then again trying to retrieve it. I was lucky to finally be able to grab an end and wiggle it out.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Saved my bathtub
customer_reviews.text: My bathtub has been draining extremely slow for a couple of months now. My hair is down past my butt so I assumed that it was my hair that was clogging it. I read the reviews on these before I made a purchase, and was honestly really worried that they weren’t gonna work. But for six bucks I figured I’d give them a try. Well, let me tell you. The picture below shows how well it worked. It took me approximately 45 seconds to get all of this out of my drain. Now my bathtub is draining with no issue at all.
customer_reviews.author: RealMomReviews

customer_reviews.title: When liquid drain cleaner fails, this gets the job done, but it can also make it worse
customer_reviews.text: All 3 of my sinks were clogged, and these did the job nicely of unclogging them. However, the serrated edges dulled, and I had to throw 2 of them out, and the third one broke *while* inside the sink. The water is moving, but someday, I might end up needing a plumber to get it out. I should have paid more to get a metal one instead.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lippa

customer_reviews.title: Drain snake broke in the drain!
customer_reviews.text: The drain snake snapped in the drain! Some other reviewers had warned of breakage so I was extra careful snaking it down the drain but it still broke. Luckily I was able to fish it out with pliers. They give you 3 in a pack. I uncoiled the second one and it snapped in my hands! Didn’t bother trying to use the 3rd one. Wasn’t going to risk having it break in the drain. Clearly this is a cheap defective product and a waste of money. I would NOT recommend
customer_reviews.author: Nunugirl

customer_reviews.title: Scum Launcher
customer_reviews.text: The design of the product itself is mediocre at best. What really is absolutely miserable about this product is that it’s packed so tightly in a coil that it has excessive plasticity and will try to return to coil in rest. This results in the snake literally flinging all of the nasty chunks of hair and scum across the bathroom and, most likely, your face when you pull it completely out. This product needs to be packed differently elsewise your going to get very frustrated and disgusted very quickly by having pipe scum launched around you and your bathroom/kitchen/etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Its a 3 pack because 2 will break (UPDATE)
customer_reviews.text: For $6 you can't expect an amazing product but they give you three because you absolutely will break them off in the drain. However, they did work. To be truthful it's better to buy ones in the store that is not curled up like these are. UPDATE: Customer service contacted me over my previous comment. The nature of these products being plastic and flexible means they will break. No question about it. However because the product did work and because customer suervice expresse concern, I changed my review to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: vincent mistretta

customer_reviews.title: Best $10 I've spent in a long time!
customer_reviews.text: Even though we have a hair catcher, our drain has been getting slow. I dropped one of these bad boys down it and a nasty, disgusting, smelly clump of hair came out! Apparently the drain catcher is only okay at its job. I cleaned off the clog remover and dropped it in for a second attempt...but got..nothing? Apparently, it pulled out all of the hair on the first shot! These things are great. I highly recommend them, and at $10 for 3 you can keep one in each bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Now I know why they come in 3s. Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Now I know why there are 3 First one snapped and broke when I tried to straighten it from packaging. Second one SNAPPED AND BROKE IN DRAIN. It’s now down in the trap and I’ll have to disassemble the whole drain to remove. Not using the 3rd. Yes, I did allow them to climatize overnight in the house after being cold from shipping. Snapped in pretty much the same place yet rest of the thing feels pliable.
customer_reviews.author: W. Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic broke
customer_reviews.text: Cheap plastic broke in my drain! Teeth are too sharp and gets stuck very easily to the point where it breaks. Pointless try something else
customer_reviews.author: techgeek

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: Total waste of money! The orange edges break off as you try to get into the sink. Just what you need more to add to your clog. I could not successfully get them in two of my drains. They are so big and bulky. Last time I ordered the drain cleaners that where round with the tiny brush at the end. They were amazing. Thought I’d save a couple dollars. What a huge mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality . Two of them broke in the first use . They send this item in coiled manner & it just remains the same you can never actually use them in straight manner down under the drain. The remaining one has sharp pointing spikes that literally gives a cut every time I tried to use it . Ended up throwing it away.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: Just Buy These!!!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, stop buying draino! I've had a problem sink since moving into this rental house for over a year. Draino bottle after draino bottle have gone down this drain to semi-clear the issue before clogging again a month later. I finally bought these, spent maybe 3 minutes, using 2 of the 3 in the pack and the sink has never drained this well since I moved in, and it's staying clear. Like other people are saying, the process is a little gross, but I put on disposable gloves and had a trash bag nearby and it wasn't that bad. It's actually nice they are disposable so you don't have to worry about cleaning a reusable snake. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!! Worthless.
customer_reviews.text: I have used these things before but not this brand. As soon as I used it in my bathtub drain and pulled it out it broke. Leaving the broken part stuck in my drain now. I tried using the second one and guess what? That one broke too! Now I have a bigger problem trying to get the broken plastic out of my drain. Will never buy these again! Dont waste your time and go spend money on a better product. What a waste! Very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: Snake Drain
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant about this particular type of snake drain but when I tried it, I was amazed. I was able to easily run it in my popup (bathroom sink) drain when it wasn't completely up and maneuver it to get out the clog. It was easy to clean and the design (has "thorns" from the top to the bottom to grab and pull out the clog from the drain and works like a zip tie) is great for an inexpensive and disposable drain snake.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. H.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap & worthless
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these, but unfortunately they were a big fail for me. They were too wide for what I needed & the keep kept getting caught on the way in, making it impossible to actually get down the pipe. The cheap plastic broke up when I began twisting it. Thinking the resistance I felt was a clog (no, the entire thing was just folded up at the bottom of the pipe) it never went through the drain deep enough to reach the clog
customer_reviews.author: Skylar Aspen Ross

customer_reviews.title: Come in bent and dont straighten out
customer_reviews.text: We ordered these as a quick, cheap fix. However, as they are photographed they come in stuck in a rounded loop. That makes it very hard to get it down the drain. They don't straighten out either, unless you bend the plastic back and risk snapping it.. Better off just paying more from the start You get what you pay for....
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Fairbrothers

customer_reviews.title: Work great.
customer_reviews.text: Had a bad shower drain in my new apartment, was a young woman living here for a couple years before me. EW, the stuff I pulled out of the drain was like hair that had begun mutating into the Marvel villain Venom. Also, I've never snaked a drain before so I was not prepared for the smell, I've got a strong stomach for everything except smells. Nothing like gagging and hacking while holding up a big wad of slimy hair dripping black stuff everywhere. But hey the product worked great, my drain is now tip top.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Y.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! CHEAP JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: I put this piece of junk down my drain this morning to try to clean it out, and when I tried to pull it out it just snapped off! Now not only is there still hair and junk in the drain, there's also a length of plastic I have to figure out a way to remove. I would give this NEGATIVE stars if I could - it didn't just fail to solve the problem, it made it significantly worse.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!! I owe $200 because of THIS product.
customer_reviews.text: WARNING: They have updated to cheap breakable plastic. This is my second order of these. This order broke in my shower drain. I'm out $200 for a plumber to remove the orange plastic. I'm in tears. Why did they change these? My first order was perfect. This new brand is cheap and break way too easy. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: J!L

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: These are cheap, and like most cheap things they break easily. Now instead of having clumps of hair in my drain I have 3 broken off plastic snakes and clumps of hair in my drain.
customer_reviews.author: why

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use.
customer_reviews.text: They need to include three because they brake so easily. First time I used it they snapped inside the drain. So now I have to try and snake it out because it’s making a bigger mess collecting everything just below the drain. Not anything like my other one I used before. That one was great but just got wore out.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: BREAK EASILY! broke off in my drain!
customer_reviews.text: i’ve tried using these twice, and they broke off in my drain both times!!! even the smallest amount of resistance will cause these to snap in half - and cause even bigger plumbing issues than those you had to begin with!! use the snakes that look almost like spoolies or pipe cleaners - they get FILTHY, but work so much better & you don’t have to worry about them breaking off and further clogging. your drain!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke H.

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about this.
customer_reviews.text: I had a majorly clogged drain and tried drano with no improvement. Used this bad boy and am really not sure what happened. I thought it was broken since it didnt grab any hairballs and when I took a shower the water didnt go down. BUT magically 2 hours later my full bathtub started bubbling, gurgling and slurping and the whole thing drained in a few seconds. Haven't had a problem since then so I guess it worked??!!
customer_reviews.author: elg

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money, will break off in drain
customer_reviews.text: Useless. One snapped when I uncoiled it, the other broke off in the drain. I was trying to avoid a $200 plumber bill to snake my drain. Looks like my plumber bill will be higher because now they have to get the piece that is in there out. I believe this is the worst item I've ever bought on Amazon
customer_reviews.author: L. Costanzo

customer_reviews.title: Simple & easy!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, if you haven’t heard of these yet you’re doing it all wrong. So easy to use and works wonders without damaging your pipes like other hard chemicals. I’ve recommended these to multiple friends with drain issues that have tried “every trick in the book” to unclog a drain and they’ve all responded the same with this being a life saver. Disclaimer: what you get out of your drain will be absolutely disgusting, so maybe don’t eat lunch before you do it... but either way, it sure beats a $100 plumber visit.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Garbage & Scamming Seller
customer_reviews.text: Garbage, straight where these belong. Don't mess around with these, just buy a real auger. They get caught in your drain and end up breaking off the teeth and clogging your drain even more. Update 1/15/2019: Seller contacted me and tried to pay me off through a refund to get me to remove or change my review to 5 stars. DO NOT BUY. PERIOD.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

product_meta.title: Vastar 3 Pack 19.6 Inch Drain Snake Hair Drain Clog Remover Cleaning Tool
feature_bullets: 3 pack of plastic plumbing snake drain auger
19. 6" flexible barbed wand can easily grab & remove clustered hair, food, garbage, and other obstructions easily
Soft enough to bend in many kinds of strainers and pipes, great for kitchen, bathroom & utility sinks, bathtubs and showers
Great drain tool for unclogging shower and sink drains, flexes at P-trap where most clogs occurred
More environmental and less expensive than toxic chemical drain cleaners

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars11,500 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
